reviews.review_msg: I failed this course 3 times, but finally passed with this professor. Imin is the GOAT.
Do all the practice questions from the textbook, practice tests, IQ and OQ consistently throughout the semester.
He's as chill like my dad

In his lectures, Imin does examples from the textbook. Students are often confused by his explanations. He speaks quietly, so it is very hard to hear him. I attended every lecture but I don't think I learned anything. It was more beneficial to use the textbook, watch Organic Chemistry Tutor, and go to ACW for help. His grading is reasonable though.
He is not the best teacher in the world but he may just be the best at SFU. Lot's of self-learning but his exams are fair.

Enlightening! Imin is such a sweetheart, his lectures are engaging and funny -- he's like my dad. Read the lecture slides, do lots of practice questions, and you'll be fine; the tests are relatively simple.

Although this professor wasn't the best at teaching, it is possible to do well in the class. I would recommend going to the ACW and learning the concepts on your own by watching Youtube. Halfway through the course, the majority of students stopped going to his lectures because they didn't learning anything from watching fly through the slides.

If you haven't taken calc in highschool, you're going to have to do a lot of self-learning. However, midterms and final had no surprises, and if you do enough review it shouldn't be too hard to do well. Most people did very poorly, but Imin is great and scaled us all like crazy!

First year calc is always going to be terrible no matter who you take with it. There are so many concepts and it can be hard to learn quick enough (or at all). The exams did not have concepts he emphasized in lecture which was annoying. They scaled marks up and marked pretty generously considering I wrote nonsense for a lot of stuff.

Gave me B midterms and finals were not that different from hw. study your cnqs attend math workshop and you should be fine. no related rates, proofing or optimization on any exam although he emphasized it during lecture.

I took calc in high school and breezed through this class without reading the textbook. Stopped going to lectures halfway through because Imin did not explain things well so get ready to teach yourself everything if you have never taken calc. Exams were very reasonable and covered key concepts. Homework questions were often harder than exams.
all lectures

Basically a full on self-study course, he throws questions in exams that weren't even on the slides/practice questions phrased completely differently to make it harder and expects us fully master over 10 subjects of the material for the exam just to put less than half of them on it with no formula sheet expecting us to memorize it.
This is the most self studying I've ever had to doin my life. He basically just spews calculations and writes down numbers without really explaining anything.
run if you get this man
He's a L mans

I would suggest sitting at the front of class because he speaks really quietly and his notes can be hard to see. He slips a few jokes once in a while, and the IQs and OQs are interesting. Overall, good prof.

The final was very difficult. He gave us 3 hours to finish 10 questions, tho. Also, the old exams on canvas did not help much, because the questions on the finals were way harder! This prof didn't give a clear note in class, so you have to study by yourself. P.s. I couldn't hear what he said sometime, because he talked so softly in class.

Hands down the worst prof I have ever had. He's constantly mumbling during lectures and the notes make absolutely NO sense. It's actually more beneficial to read the textbook than go to his lectures. If you're going into this class with just pre-cal12 knowledge I suggest getting a different prof or a tutor because he doesn't explain anything.
Final was too difficult. A lot more than either midterm. Other than that good guy. If u take him make sure u do lots of practice.

Clear, concise, organized professor. However, he tends to explain the material even worse than the textbook. First midterm was relatively easy, second midterm was a few notches harder. Final was insanely difficult. Nice guy though.
He is a difficult professor who is too smart for the average person.
you'll only see him in lectures.. other than that.. you won't find him anywhere else..
Very simple, your grade is directly related to the exercise you do. no shortcut.
All examples are from the textbook, if you read ahead and read the explainations it makes class alot more easy to understand. He went through very helpful examples right before FINAL!
his notes are pretty much just a replica of the textbook ...that doesn't explain things clearly..so you're better off reading the textbook itself

I never went to class, because in university you should sometimes be prepared to teach yourself everything. And as long as you study on your own time, his tests are so easy that you will do fine. But never go to class, it is a waste of time with this professor.

He expects the students to do the questions as fast as he can. He blows through the material really fast.  Likes to mumble to himself while solving equations during lecture not involving the students in the solving process.  If you have this prof get ready to read the text alot and learn on ur own, ohh and the text SUCKS.

He is a nice guy and makes good notes but he runs through the material like no tomorrow so you better be able to write fast to catch up (I swear he must be the fastest writer alive). Exams were a little tricky more on the hard side. He slips out a joke once in a blue moon but the classes are really boring!!

I took math 157 with her this semester. Her midterms were quite easy but the final was fricking hard. It was at least 5 times more difficult than the midterm. some people even cried after the final cuz it was really hard. For grading, she is stubborn. she enforces you to use the same formula or method in assignments or midterm.
Prof was nice and easy to approach. Course was difficult
She's a good teacher, just seems nervous during lecture because she doesn't have a lot of experience. Very helpful and friendly when you see her at ACW. Overall, she's great and worth taking.

Nicola Mulberry is a fantastic calculus lecturer. She makes topics very clear and easy to understand, and her positive attitude makes the material a lot more approachable. I am very bad at math in general, but Nicola's teaching ability made me understand complex topics a lot better. I would not hesitate to take another course with her. Amazing!

very friendly and knows her stuff. But she is nervous and doesnt seem comfortable speaking in front of a crowd. She goes over simple examples in class and leaves you to try out the harder ones on your own. If you think you understand the material well enough just because you paid attention in class THINK AGAIN - The exams will kill you.

Bad professor. She was all over the place and wasn't very organized. Would have outburst middle of the class but that was mainly due to students talking. However, the tests were not to bad so if you studied properly you should do fine. Final was horrible. I think the average was a fail but unsure since she didnt release the class average for it.

I had a great experience in MATH157 with prof Mishna.  She would come to the ACW and help any students in there that didn't understand the concept taught in class.  She can sometimes be a bit frazzled during lectures or make a couple of errors but she is dyslexic lol (she told us when it happened like 8 times in a lecture).
She is the best teacher known to man. Would take her again!

She makes so many mistakes while teaching and she's not the best at explaining concepts. There was a lecture where 3 separate people asked her the same question and she could not answer it properly. I don't think I learned a thing from her all semester had to teach myself everything. Her midterms are fair but the final was crazy hard.

She is clearly very passionate about Math and this would sometimes mean that she would get into the theory a little more than needed. At first, I was a little nervous about how her exams may be but it turns out her Midterms were easier than expected and completely fair. However, the final was definitely challenging. Overall, nothing to be scared of

Mr. Mahdad is definitely one of the better math professors I have had in my life. I always disliked math but he made it quite tolerable. He is also very passionate about teaching math as well. Do be warned that classes sometimes feel like they are going on for too long and you may find it boring if you can't concentrate for too long.

Good prof. Mahdad takes all questions and will be really patient to answer them through multiple office hours or even in class. However, his lectures, or the course itself are quite challenging. A tip for everyone viewing this review: If you can solve all his homework questions and get the logic behind, you will succeed this course. Good luck!
Really nice Prof. Subject is hard though.

Good professor as he will explain in details is you're not clear with the question but his lecture is quite boring sometimes. I don't have a strong foundation in math so i find this course is hard for me. Should've taken his math100 instead of this. Midterms are harder than final.

Previously, I had problems with mathematics, so did not expect much from this course, but Mahdad showed himself as a very good teacher, his tests are heavy, but in fact it is very helpful in the final work.
Don't take him if you are currently struggling with Math. Just avoid him at all times.

Mahdad explains his materials very clearly and will go over them again if you don't understand anything. Just go over the handouts of the previous week before each in-class quiz and you should be fine with the quizzes. Midterms are fair and final is easy. No need to study from the textbook, just go over the handouts (again) and the review samples.
he is a good teacher and nice. i think he is a good teacher for math157
The best teacher for this course at FIC in my opinion. Explains materials with the utmost simplicity and takes weekly quizzes that give us an incentive to study.

HE does not update the recorded lecture in time, which leads me have to study myself to finish assignments. Also, near the end of the semester, he did not update the lectures from class; instead, he used the video from the past which is inconsistent with the lecture notes. And he never rely your emails...

Be prepared to never get email responses back. 3 times now I've had to email him, the TA, and then finally the math undergrad adviser to remind Vijay just to get back to me. Grades tough but overall is clear and concise with his lectures. No problem with his teaching just everything else about him.
vijay is one the best math prof at SFU. At this point of pandemic he is more helpful than many of other professors. go vijay go!
Had him last term, was of no help at all. Never replied to emails, and really terrible instruction with homework and teaching. Do not take it with him.

I am also currently in Vijay's class. He is a fantastic professor and his jokes are quite enjoyable. There's no way to make the math easy, however, Vijay makes the lecture fun. The person who was complaining about his jokes in class is quite unaware of how some other professors can be. Great class, great prof, would highly recommend to anyone.

taking his class right now. REALLY BAD LECTURER. MAKES JOKES THAT ARE NOT EVEN FUNNY. THE WAY HE LECTURES IS VERY CONFUSING BECAUSE HE IS CHANGING TOPICS IN BETWEEN OTHER TOPICS. HE MAKES SEVERAL MISTAKES WHILE LECTURING AND SAYS " IF YOU DO THAT IN THE EXAM YOU WILL LOSE MARKS, BUT I WONT BECAUSE IM THE ONE TEACHING HAHA" REALLY BAD PROF!!!!!
Highly recommended!
To be honest, I have no idea how he marks the in-class quizzes and the exams. He just keeps marking my papers wrong again and again.

Vijay was a hilarious professor and always had the class laughing. He is easy going and was always willing to help students if you needed him. He was unorganized with homework assignments but besides that I would recommend him to everyone!
Easiest class I've taken. Thought Math157 would be hard, but ended up being a GPA booster.

Vijay's the man. He is enthusiastic in the work he does and he is willing to work with students if they have concerns. It is really fun attending his lectures and he is one of the most easy going guys.
NO! Really made it difficult to succeed in an already difficult class. Not very helpful. A nice guy, but not a great teacher. I recommend taking this class with someone else if at all possible.

he goes over very basic examples in class and seems very unprepared. Sometimes he looks at the textbook and just wings the section based off the first example in the text or he'll make the simplest thing he can make to finish it quickly. Definitely needs to put more time in preparing his lectures.

For the first half of the semester, it seems as if he just took the first boat out of india to teach math at SFU. His accent is hard to understand at times, makes frequent mistakes in class, breezes through important material. But recently, he has been showing more effort by giving us notes. Nice guy at heart but being a professor is not his forte

The first and second midsem were very fair as it was mostly online questions and instructor assignments. Review class is a definite boost for exams. He is helpful in person.The big drawback is that he doesnt puts the  notes online.

I agree with the first person who commented.  He puts down anyone who asks questions and never really answers them when asked. He is unprepared to class and when he writes a hard question he just ends up skipping over it.  He covers very little or only the very surface of concepts being tested on and consistently makes mistakes in his classes.
Dr. Singh is a very good teacher. He is very helpful and gives extra time at the end of the class for questions. But he doesn't gives notes.
Excellent Prof. To bad his hands are tied by Petra.
He would be the best prof if he didnt use Petra Menzs notes and exams. He is funny but needs to make his own exams and notes.
Take her
Great Math instructor
She was so helpful and welcome questions from students. I had a hard time at first trying to get along with her accent. But then it turned out to be ok as time goes by.
she's just amazing teacher. she loves her subject and is willing to make her students to love that subject too.
great prof, tests r super easy.

This man is blessing to this earth compared to Steve Gibson. I love how he is compassionate and empathetic. He will give extensions when needed. He does not require participation in class. He explains everything very well and goes over questions nicely. He is a loving man and inspiration to the SFU community. I aspire to be like him. XOXO
great professor, easy tests.

Justin is a SUPER nice guy, but he definitely HATES when people are talking. He's open to student questions and going over any questions not understood. Teaches great and the midterm and final are not too bad. He gives extensions on assignments and is very friendly when asking for help.

HANDS DOWN BEST PROF FOR 157. I absolutely loved having Justin as a prof. I have taken this course 3 times before but always dropped it due to the profs talking so fast or generally sucked at teaching. Justin made sure we thoroughly understood the concepts. Quick email responses, very approachable, goes out of his way to make sure we get help.
He was a great prof at teaching. Does not let anyone talk while he teaches so if you chit chat not the class for you.

I usually just come here to vent about my profs, HOWEVER...

Justin Chan has been the best professor I have had over 3 years at SFU. The most organized prof I have seen; incredible grading speed, clean + comprehensive lectures and reliable email accessibility.

He will call you out for talking during his lectures. He is very 'no nonsense'.
Really nice guy, but he always gets behind and confused. Always will answer question even if it's basic mathematical knowledge.
Great prof for calc especially if u did not take calc in highschool before. Pay attention to the lecture notes and do all cnqs and ull be fine!

Class was fine as long as you do all the homework (there wasn't a lot) and the MathXL questions (a lot + takes a long time to do). Quizzes weren't bad but exams were hard. You have to study a lot more than what's assigned to do really well. Prof was very helpful always staying past class hours to answer questions. Office hours were very useful too!

Justin is a good prof. He tries his best to explain as much as he can during lectures but can speed up and make mistakes. This class was definitely hard as I took only pre calc in highschool. You need to spend lots of time as for the mathxl hw, additional textbook hw, midterms and final!

Math is a tough course but Justin is very helpful. Attending his office hours are the best way to get questions answered, as he will show you how to do them! Often stays past office hour times to cover all student's questions. Overall very caring professor, I recommend him as a prof!

This class was super hard but Justin made it easy to understand the material and answer any questions a student had. There is online homework (math xl) due every week and extra questions to help students study. Would recommend taking this class alone or with only one other class because he goes through the lectures pretty fast.

Justin Chan is a good prof. I took 2 of his classes, math10 and math157 and scored really well. Don't look at the negative comments as i'm sure they were the ones who did bad on the exams. He is an extremely accommodating prof and will understand ur problems. He does make a few errors in his lectures while teaching but corrects them immediately.

Professor Chan is honestly one of the best profs for math. Although he does tend to make mistakes in his lectures, they are often minor. I am not a math person and I actually learned a lot in this course and Justin is good at teaching the concepts. The midterms and final are doable and you should be able to get a decent grade if you study.

Horrible Horrible Prof, after Pyke he is the 2nd worst prof at the entire University. He does not have a clue as to what he is doing. Makes so many mistakes during lectures that he himself gets confused as to what is going on. But, for Math 157 he is the easiest prof to take. Compared to the other math professors, his exams are a piece of cake.

Justin is always super lost, super confused, doesn't know anything himself and is constantly asking Pyke (devil) on how to run the course, doesn't do examples because "if I try I might get them wrong". Talks about the weather for the first 10 minutes, and just uploads any examples we don't do in class without even telling how he got the answers.

Professor Chan is a patient guy, but he does not manage the time well. A 50 minutes lecture will be extended to 1.2hour-1.5hour. After 50 minutes he will mention that you can go now, but he will keep writing and explaining questions. Of course those questions will not be go over (or briefly go over like for 2 minutes) in the next class.

Definitely not a 4.1/5 prof. Midterm was brutally hard to complete in the time frame. Lectures are far to rushed. expectation is to already know half the course. if you aint a tryhard you getting crushed in this class.

Justin is great and is very prompt unlike many professors with the new online format. He is approachable and encourages questions. practice the questions he assigns (IQs and CNQs) and you should do well, the rest is luck and not stressing out during exams.
His exams are unfair. do not take his class. He literally made the final hard because he didn't invigilate the midterms which are not the student's fault.

He does not know how to teach an online class. Do not recommend it during COVID. He did not invigilate the midterms so the averages were high. Instead made the final really difficult causing people to not pass. I know most students had a decent mark before the final. This was unfair.

I found it difficult to understand him, he has a heavy accent. Lectures are boring and his slides are directly from the textbook publisher. He writes examples on a small white board in a big lecture hall. Examples are also from the textbook. Tests are extremely easy and there is no online homework like other math courses. Easy to self teach.

Ping Ding is an awful prof and has a very thick accent. Be prepared to teach yourself all of the material from the textbook as you will not learn much in the lectures. His midterms though were both fair and the final exam was quite straightforward as long as you did the review.
Be prepared to self teach your self the entire course. He has a thick accent which makrs it difficult to understand him. Midterms were very fair but the final exam was brutal.

Terrible prof. Notes he gives are exactly the same as the textbook but illegible, and you can barely understand what he is saying through his thick accent. Only pro to this class is the exams were fair. Be prepared to self-teach yourself the entire class...
Hard class taught by an OK teacher. Had to get a tutor. Do the Lon Capa, it will bump your grade up so much if you do well with it.
run while you still can

If you are a Beedie student who is only taking this course because you have to, do not take it with Weiran! Her exams are extremely unfair and difficult. The average for the midterm was 40%! She expects way too much from Calc I students

Atrocious professor, do not take this course with her unless you're a calculus whiz or have no other choice. Her unclear notes and the lack of ability to explain most concepts will leave you confused when it comes to her (very difficult)assignments and exams. Very reluctant to answer questions during lectures and office hours. Avoid like the plague
The tests are tough. But she is nice and she is always willing to help students.
tbh his lecture is kinda boring, but he is an easy grader. Just stick to what he said before the test and you will be fine

His lecture kind of boring and not efficient, you have to prepare and learn by youself alot. But he is caring and give you a lot of paper although he has bad hand writting but i can saw his effort in preparing that, He is very easy grader and exam is the same as how he give you
His teaching was very confusing and i learned all of the material from youtube instead, genuinely nice old guy though and would help you if needed, his grading wasn't harshe aswell.

His class felt like constant torture, unless youa re good in math you won't to great. He explains things on a basic level and then the quizzes and midterm are compeltely different. The only reason I would take this course again is to better my grade since it messed up with my GPA. Don't recomment.
Idk how he's still here

I finished math157 with Nessim Tariq in FIC and the best advice I can give you is to be well prepared in advance if you want to do well in thic course.He is just solving assignments during class and often leaves you confused with so many questions and no explanation.But I found the approach to him. If you want to discover more-jong24094 - email

A very responsible professor is very patient to teach students knowledge, if you promptly ask questions about any points you do not understand, you will get a good grade in the course. Best choice in MATH 157.
Definitely not worth your time.

Most of your learning comes from you reading the notes he gives out with bad handwriting. It's nice that he cares enough to write the deductions for us but I wish he'd use his doctorate to teach us instead of showing off the many advanced methods he knows.

He'll introduce something math majors learn and give you a week to master it with a midterm

Could a professor be any worse? This guy drones on about points that are entirely and then completely ignores relevant material. You learn nothing but roundabout arithmetic in lecture that does not at all help with course material.
Worst teacher ive ever had. Avoid him!
Worst teacher ive ever had. He is a really bad grader and doesnt help anyone at all. I would absolutely dont recommend him to anyone.

Absolute worst! Choosing him as my professor was one of the worst mistake of my life. This guy is not fit to teach anyone. Even when you submit correct answers, He finds a way to to lower your marks and fail you. His midterms and finals are so unnecessarily hard. Please don't ever choose him as your professor. He'll turn your life into hell.
His accent was not really good.

You basically have to do the whole course by yourself. Doesn't teach anything and can't explain topics even after you've had an appointment with him. If you picked this class, change your prof NOW. The class may seem easy at first but soon you'll be drowning in work and the prof won't be there to explain topics when you need it the most.

Oh my, where to start. His "lectures" are him reading through his notes that we can already download for ourselves, and they are so bad that you would end up more confused than when you started. Since I was in an intense class there was Hw for 4-5 new subtopics every 3-4 days (20-25 sums) which is just not feasible if you have other subjects too.
Hard to listen what he said.
His accent is strong. Be ready to learn everything by YOURSELF. You won't have enough time to finish his quiz online.
Does not teach a thing (Probably because he's always too tired). Fair grader. YOU WILL HAVE TO DO EVERYTHING ON YOUR OWN. Everything.

Wow, could a professor be any worse? This guy drones on about points that are entirely pointless (e.g. a number times a number cannot be negative) and then completely ignores relevant material. You learn nothing but roundabout arithmetic in lecture that does not at all help with course material.
His teaching was fine but not up to mark
His accent is difficult to understand, but his exam is easy.
doesn't teach a thing, gotta do everything by yourself

He is a good teacher. He is a fair grader, however you need to study a lot by yourself because his teaching is a little bit hard to understand. He doesn't give a lot of homework and his quizzes are easy but you need to work really hard by yourself
I really dont recommend him.
If u want a A for 157, just go for him. Even though the handouts and lectures are not clear enough, but your homework and journals matter a lot. I did terrible in final and get B+
He is a passionate teacher who really care about students. His exams are easy and he doesnt force you to study too much. Highly recommend to take his class.

Be one of my best professor :) he understands wat u need and he even gives u chances to get higher grade for ur assignments & ur midterms. The final is easy enough since it combines approximately 80% wat u did in midterms. He may be hard for you to understand what he means but please take time with him and do what he says, you will be very good :)

TERRIBLE!HORRIBLE PROF! NEVER listens to students, doesnt care about the course. very unclear.dont attend his lectures!u gonna be confused! he should not teach at univ!makes lots of mistakes. final is really hard. my best advice- read the book, chapter after chapter and you will do ok. i got A- in course.i advice you to avoid him at all costs!
prof is not highly interested and course, and even quite irrelevant. it really hard to understand him

the best prof i've ever taken. exams were easy, hardly even had to go to class. accent was a little hard to understand here and there but for the most part he was very willing to answer questions. i would take him again.

well...math157 IS HARD. I got a c+ even tho i put lot of effort. BUT HOWEVER, we should see that coming in math157. He is a nice person, tho, even tho his writing is kinda bad, but once you remember the way he right, it will be fine. Suggestion to math157: work hard, hard, harder!! lol

Never reviewed a prof but I have to cus he is that bad. Lecs are horrible and useless cus he just writes w/out explaining the steps + he has super tiny writing which doesn't help at all. Doing txtbk questions won't help cus his exams are WAY more difficult than what you see on the assignments + textbook. Wording on exams are ambiguous. Avoid him.

WORST prof I've ever had, I know this sounds harsh but unfortunately I stopped going to lectures because he was so bad at teaching, his accent definitely made things worse , and he literary copies the notes on the board and thats it. I cant believe I actually paid for this class not to mention his exams are so unreasonably hard.
Writing is very small, midterm was noting like the previous midterms, much more difficult. Makes mistakes on his lecture slides.

Horrible Prof,                new to SFU,                       hard exams and doesn't curve,      Just simply copies his notes onto overhead for and hour and  leaves including his mistakes                                Recommend not slacking and studying from textbook and you'll walk away with a decent grade, i doubt there will be any A+'s
I cant believe I am paying this amount of tuition for this kind of professor.
Worst math prof ever. His writing is illegible. He mumbles and is very hard to understand even when speaking clearly. He basically just fills in his slide notes and doesn't try to actually explain.
I failed the diagnostic and still got a A- lmao very good teacher.
Fair grading and had good experience taking this course with Paul.

He was a good Prof in general. His lectures were sometimes messy, but his exams aren't difficult at all - very fair and match well with your provided sample exams. He's also very helpful, supportive, and a nice guy overall

This man is the true goat and the greatest PUPPER of all time. Not only were his lectures amazing, but they were also amazing. He gave everyone an A+ for no reason which was pretty sick. He would also always talk about sports with us and do Messi's celebrations when people would ask questions! #TupperedUp #Math #nicee #cute #PaulTupperIsATallPupper

Paul did a great job teaching this difficult class. The exam grades were low so it had to get scaled, but that benefited most people. His Instructor Questions were incredibly difficult though, almost unnecessarily compared to what you get tested on.

Paul did a great job in his first semester teaching this challenging course. Despite the complexity of the material, he explained concepts clearly in lectures and was very responsive via email, helping me with a very pressing issue which I am extremely grateful for. Like any math course, be prepared to work hard and stay on top of the coursework.

Paul is a good teacher who does his best to explain difficult concepts. summer 2024 was his 1st time teaching this course and he did his best. Our averages were fairly low but the class got scaled at the end, which bumped me up a couple letter grades. he's easy to approach and alway willing to answer questions.

A super nice prof. If you've learned calculus before, his class is just piece of cake. But, if havent, his class is helpful and clear. Pretty straight forward. Midterms are easy but fair unless you are lazy.

Very good teacher. Knows what he's teaching and explains concepts really well. Very organized and covers all material very well. Is there to help when you don't understand material. Overall a good guy!

I was looking online at how my previous professor was doing, but sad to see that Dr. Gary Sabin has passed away in 2023 July. He was one of the best professor I had the honour to taken a class with. His lectures are clear and you can see he put a lot of work into teaching us, it's unfortunate that he will no longer teach other students. RIP Gary

I was never good at math, but Gary enabled me to score A. He explained general concepts at the beginning of the lecture and then solved every kind of example with all steps. I took Math 157 in FIC, 2022 Fall. I really appreciate him improved my mathematical solving skills and removed all the difficulty through his course.
Rest in peace Gary.

Really patient to help students to achieve to get a good grades. Also, if you have questions may ask him during the office hour to teach. He is very supportive when students are struggling with math. However, the final and midterms are worth 90% of the course, so have to really prepare and work hard on it. Overall, highly recommend him!
He gives you extra points for good process in the quizzes and midterm exams. He tries to make the class more entertaining and is caring. But sometimes its hard to follow some lectures.

Gary is very nice and caring. He is funny and would try to make the class less boring. Homework can be done in just a few hours. Quizzes, Tests, mid-term and Final are not too hard and quite similar to the homework. Pay attention to his review, it most likely to be on the Test.

Mr. Gary is a very respected teacher at the institution and he is very passionate about the class and subject. he gives you instant feedback and explains till you understand. his office hours are worth it. lot of homework . he's big on PRACTICE ! his midterms carry alot of weight. overall he is a great prof.
Best Teacher
Just want to say he is amazing
He is a very dedicated prof. You gotta love him.
Took 157 with him. Though lectures are boring, he makes things easy for you on exams. Kind of shy, but an interactive person. Think math is hard? Take math with him, makes things easy.

German accent overpowers lectures so its sometimes impossible to understand what he's saying, can't imagine how ESL students cope. Very poor job at actually explaining concepts, rather he reads verbatim the notes on the overhead, which you could do at home.
Cool prof. Was nervous at beginning of semester because I think it was his first semester but got over it fast. Clear notes, doesn't try to trick you.
Really nice professor. Review example from notes, his exams are straight from them so very fair.

Failed 157 before, retaking it with him I got an A. Very clear notes with lots of examples. Exams are examples we see in notes, no surprises. Very fair. Light German accent but will probably only be problem if you're very ESL.  Great math prof!
Can't hear what's he saying in class. mumbles all the way. His review session for exams are useless, very bad. No one in class participated when he asked questions. Seriously, don't take his class.
JUST DONT.
Please Don't take her course.

DO NOT under any circumstance take her class. If you are given this prof drop the class. She is the least understanding person I have ever had the misfortunate of interacting with. Started the class by joking about how inaccessible she is and the semester went down hill from there. Dr. Menz does not realize that first years does not have PHD's
take her if you wanna fail 157
Dont take math 157 with her unless you wanna fail
Decent math prof. Felt bad because she was constantly joked about and turned into a meme. Her slides are helpful. Exams were fair.

Midterms are not as easy as he says during the review session. 50 minutes are a rush for writing his midterms. He is a nice professor tho!

Lots of homework, but necessary because constant practice will help you do well. Utilize the ACW if you need help. Midterms were exactly what he said it would be. He literally tells you what will be tested. Join the math 157 group/chat (some really smart ppl post all the answers to the assignment questions and some dude even helped tutor me)
Exams are exactly like the questions he goes over in class. Just memorize those and you'll be fine.

He has a thick accent, but if you sit closer to the front you will be okay. His midterms are reasonable if you attend the review session, and some questions are similar to the instructor questions. The final is brutal; it is nothing like the midterms. Study hard, and do well on everything else to make up for the final.

Good professor for people who didn't take calculus in high school. His notes are useful, but he doesn't post most of his lectures notes online (only chapters 1-3, 7, and 10). His mid terms are easy if you study the lecture notes, textbook questions, and his instructor questions. He might curve the grade after the finals.

I think that he's a decent professor; however, I personally don't think I learned that much from him. Since I took Calculus in high school, most of the material covered in MATH 157 was the same. His midterms are extremely easy and his final is alright -- just got to be careful.

he makes calculus really easy and tells students what will be tested on the exam. final is a little bit challenging, two midterms are easy as long as you go through the homework and the textbook question.

His accent is a bit thick and can be hard to understand at times. Weekly homework two midterms and a final that'll take the maximum amount of time given. As long as you do lots of practice you should be fine. For the final he gives a list of exactly what will be on it so practice all the harder examples.

Mr. Choi is decent teacher. His accent is a bit hard to understand at first but you get use to it. I didnt take calculus in high school so the course was hard for me.  The midterms are straight forward however the final is a bit challenging. The class is scaled so as long as you put in some work you should be fine. EXPECT HOMEWORK.

Mr. Choi was a great professor. His lectures can be tough to understand but he is very clear in ACW/office. He also is specific in what you need to know for the tests which is very helpful. Always go to him for questions you dont understand and do the textbook questions, its what helped me.

Stephen is a very caring and enthusiastic professor. He definitely simplified the course a lot, and he will TELL you what is exactly on exams. If you want to excel in this course, practice questions in advance, don't just rely on friends and study instructor questions/past exams. Also, go to workshop if you have questions!

Choi is a decent professor at SFU. His lectures may be a little difficult to understand but he is always available for help during his office hours. Exams are not too difficult if you study well for them
Puts himself in the ACW, rare for professors but was extremely help to understand him more as a person and his style of teaching. Overall great prof

Tbh, I am getting between a B+ and A- in this class. I got 25/30 on the first mid term and 27/30 on the second mid term. A lot of people complain that this course is hard yet Choi makes it as easy as he can make it. The two mid terms were easier than my pre calc 12 tests (I did not even take calc in high school). Chapter 10 however, is really hard.

Mr. Choi is there to gives great onee-to-one help when I drop in to the Applied Calculus Worrkshop. His lectures  are thorough, though they may be hard to understand. Sitting closer to the front might be helpful to hear him better.

It's hard to understand his accent, but you get used to it. No time to listen to him because you'll be writing notes so fast. Honestly though, this class is easier then my high school calculus 12 class. The midterms were extremely easy. If you're not math minded like me then I suggest keeping on track with the work.

He did a great job of explaining concepts clearly. His accent isn't nearly as bad as other people have commented, I found him easy to understand. He's passionate about math, and it's clear he's taught for a long time because he knows how to teach math well. Very helpful if you visit him in the workshop. I'd definitely take a class with him again.

He did a great job of explaining concepts clearly.  His accent isn't nearly as bad as other people have commented, I found him easy to understand. He's passionate about math, and it's clear he's taught for a long time because he knows how to teach math well.  Very helpful if you visit him in the workshop. I'd definitely take a class with him again.

nice guy, really available and willing to help you out. After a while you get used to his accent but it is sorta hard in the beginning.  Go through the text questions and instructor questions before midterms and final because all of the questions are the same or very similar to that material. Midterms weren't bad, final was pretty challenging.

Lectures were confusing sometimes and not completely necessary because everything (including examples) are from the textbook. Both midterms were fair. Almost all of the questions from midterms were from textbook questions and homework assignments (would recommend doing ALL the assigned textbook questions before midterms). Final was challenging -ish
Enjoyable prof. Do the practice questions, homework, instructor questions. Time yourself to work fast cause for a final out of 100 marks, there's no time to waste.
Overall, if you study you will do fine. I don't recommend going to lecture though. He teaches directly from the book so it isn't very helpful.
Midterms were okay but the final was killer. He's difficult to understand during lectures but just copy all the notes and you should be good.
The exams are hard. The average for the midterm was 50%. Also the Professor only goes over the same examples in the textbook and it is difficult to understand what he says as well.
Dr. Choi was hard to understand at times but if you ask him he will help you. Midterms were fair but the final was a bit difficult.
Difficult to understand him. Exams are okay.

Despite his heavy accent, Dr. Choi is a patient and resourceful professor. He is always willing to help so if you are ever stuck, go to his TA hours. The exams are extremely fair. If you have a hard time with his accent, make sure to sit in the front of lecture!

He is not that bad. But it's kind of hard to understand his lecture in the first month but after you got use to it. The final was sososo hard. it was a huge let down! I could have got a A-but because of the final, I got dropped so much! not recommand!

People always criticize about his English skill, but it's not THAT bad that you can't understand him at all.  Lectures are important if you want to ace the exams, the examples are somewhat helpful.  If you go to him for help directly, he'll go over the question step by step patiently.  Very nice guy, just that exams were bit harder than I thought.

The final is brutally marked, I dropped more than a letter grade after the final. Not the professor you would consider to take your math with. Well oh well,good job on making a 100 level calculus tougher than it meant to be.

His midterms were pretty much like his weekly assignments. His final wasn't too bad and there was enough time to finish. Go to his review class and study according to that and you'll do well. He's nice and willing to help. Textbook really wasn't needed unless to clarify or get more practice.
I thought I could get at least a B- in his class before the final, now that the final exam marks are out, my grade dropped faster than a water fall.

Attending his lectures is completely useless other than the fact that you get "hints" about the midterms/finals. However, his hints usually screw you over. His English is terrible. But, he's a nice guy if you talk to him in person.

i thought i was gonna die cuz i hated math; and i struggled cuz i didnt do calc in high school. but, math is ALL abt practice - as long as u work hard, u can do it. i failed first midterm, but got 85% on 2nd one. i evn ended up liking math! while choi can't teach, his exams are fair. learning math via youtube/txtbook helped me instead!

It was hard to understand what he was saying. He talked straight from his notes, very little ecplainations. His midterms were fair, but there was not enough time to finish the questions, even tough you can finish it but no time to go over. Final exam was horrible, long and hard!
This course wasn't easy but the exams were very fair. Make sure you do all of the homework questions and you will do fine.

Has an accent, but follows the txt closely, so if you don't understand, you can review @ home. TA marks the HW extremely tough, so it's easy to lose a lot of marks over small mistakes. MTs & Finals are fair but too long, needs good understanding & perfect calculations 1st time as there's no time to go over it again.

It's difficult to understand him but you get use to it.  He basically teaches straight from the text so many don't go to lecture.  I did attend lecture though since I don't like studying from the text, and his MT and final only test you on what he taught in class so if you don't go to class and just study text, you may end up studying for too much.
His exams are very fair if you did the assignments in the textbook and know your stuff. If I had to take another math course, definitely would want to take it with him!

Apart from his accent he is very helpful. First midterm is good.. Second midterm is good too but not enough time to finish. The final was pretty hard though. But then again that was for my year. All in all just study because he is not ridiculously difficult.

Gives lots of hints for the midterms and there are never trick questions, if you know your stuff it's an easy A. A little hard to understand at times but if you write down the notes in class and just read them later its all good!

He is probably the easiest prof out of all the others for this class. However, I still found the class difficult because I had no previous calculus background. Attend the workshops and get help as soon as you don't understand something, because it's really easy to fall behind.

Notes are clear, mostly from textbook but explained thoroughly. Gives a lot of hints about the midterms. Go to review session! Long final but just have to understand all of his examples from his notes and the written assignments.

Both midterms were pretty easy and fair, but the final was very hard. He also gave many hints for the final, but didn't stick to what he said, which screwed over quite a few people. Study EVERYTHING, and make sure you do all of the homework questions in the textbook and understand them thoroughly.
EXTREMELY BORING LECTURES. DO YOUR HOMEWORK AND YOU WILL GET A GOOD GRADE.
Very easy exams, notes are helpful, exams similar to book examples and lectures' examples

nice prof,organized notes,you dont hv to flip over ur textbk once u hv attended to his class and the test paper is easier then the other class,for my class, our class average is 22/30,thats pretty nice isnt it
Ok prof
Nice guy! Very clear and gives a lot of hints for exams. Best prof in SFU mathmatical department!
He is great, highly recommend him.
Awesome prof! anyone who knows jack **** about math.. this is the class u should be in to get a decent mark
Pretty good prof. Tended to move at warp speed during the last half of class and make lots of mistakes on the overhead. But all in all a good prof to take this class with.
He is probably the eziest calculus prof in SFU. The best ever!!
No Comments

Easy tests but a terrible lecturer. Lectures are totally useless. You're better off staying home and learning out of the textbook. Especially since all his in class examples are straight out of the book.
hard to understand

Maybe it was due to the fact that too much people got A's in the last semester, this semester's course was harder. People attended last semester looked at my work and said it was hard. Also, Online questions on LON CAPA was hard (even MATH 154 students had some difficulties). Quizzes are okay if you practice. Paper assignment was okay too!!!

The good: easy tests. The Bad: everything else. A bit of an accent, boring, moves at a snail's pace, notes are straight out of the text, examples in class are easy but online assignments are WAY harder, puts simple concepts in sentence form and makes it impossible to understand. Easy marks but every lecture seemed like the longest hour of my life

He's a nice man. The course is relatively easy. But how he scaled down everyone's grades really made many students unhappy. However, homeworks, quizzes and finals are easy marks. If you already took Calculus in High school, you can get marks easily in this course=)
Oh KK Choi, with his argyle sweaters and horijontal lemets. Love this man. Incredibly easy class, and lots of help provided by the calculus workshop if needed.

Nice prof, some minor errors in lecture notes, but corrects most of them.  Lecture notes taken from txt, hw are easy marks, quizes aren't too hard, & final is fairly ok.  However, there were too many A's in the class, so he had to adjust the grading scheme (many ppl's grades were lowered by 2 letter grades ).

For every class, you jot down notes from the overhead. His notes come directly from the text book. Text book questions are way easier than the online hmk assignments. His Tests are VERY fair. If you actually do the work, are able to answer all the text book questions, it is an easy A/B.
Nice prof, with fair marking. Suggest taking a class with him!

He makes many many many careless mistakes in lectures, but he's ok overall. His quizzes and even the final was incredibly easy... Probably the easiest course in uni. However, I still can't understand why he scaled the whole class down at the end. That really sucked and wasn't fair AT ALL. Plus i sent him over 5 e-mails and got no replies or anythin

This prof makes a lot of mistakes. His examples are not unique, taken straight out of textbook. Point? We can go look at it ourselves! He tries to teach too much material, since not all of it is tested anyways. Besides, my opinion: the math 12 stuff he taught in the beginning was useless. Otherwise, the course itself really is not that difficult.

Dr. Choi is really helpful! People who laugh at him in class are immature and just looking for attention while distracting everyone else. Mildly hard course content but he made it really easy to learn. Doesn't give trick questions and is very responsive to any mistakes or concerns. Definately recommend taking his courses!

easiest prof I've had in university! very recommended! for mt, just study inclass examples and u will be fine, like he promises, he'll only test on what u have seen before.  seriously, ppl who complain that he is hard have minimal effort in trying

He's not the best prof but the course was easy itself. Heavily based on the textbook, so even if you do not go to lectures, make sure you keep up with the textbook and you will do fine. A lot of self-learning involved so don't screw around.

Easiest math prof EVER..sexy and fair.  Quizzes and final questions were basically straight out of the textbook.  No trick questions and extends hwk due dates when students tell him.  Easy course = Easy A. Cheers!
hard course content, that he simplifies pretty well.  Maybe a struggle at first, but as long as you use the textbook everthing is great

This prof is probably the easiest prof u'll get in university.  For quizes just read examples from the text.  Has a bad accent, make mistakes, but dont even need to goto his class, just learn from the text book.  Do the homework yourself, goto the quizes and finals, and you'll get an A.

This class is TOO easy and thus not fair to those who study. Final exam Qs ALL from previous hw, Quiz Qs ALL from textbook example. His accent is acceptable, to those who lived in east van for years, which we used to hear similar accent everyday. So disappointed at students DONT study at ALL but LAUGH at him, so much noise that others cant listen.

His class is extremely easy! He has a bit of an accent, but his writing is incredibely neat, so it makes everything ok.  People who can't understand him are just uncultured and need to start talking to people from different nationalities. The quizzes and final are straight from the HW. He cut out almost half of the course content for the final!

He has very good notes and lots of examples, he is very fair on his quizzes and understands when you can't get an assignment done on time. Very nice guy, easy to understand if you pay attention. A little too patient, takes too much from his class.

Kk choi is a really good easy math teacher. It's very possible to get a very high mark in this class. He teaches things not to trick but to teach them in an easy way. It's sad that so many students make fun of him but he is so easy going.
No Comments

Very clear in his lectures, and fairly easy assignments. The quizzes are not hard if you study for them. People complain about his mistakes, but hey he's only human! They would probably learn more if they didn't spend so much time trying to find flaws in his work. The only down side is the thick accent.
Personally I found there wasn't much point in going to class other than to hear him say "horijontal asymptote" (no that isn't a typo!).  Just a really easy course in general.
He can be difficult to understand, his accent is fairly thick.

Not clear whatsoever!! This guy is a joke! He has made a mistake every class since day 1. I can hardly understand his english, sigh.... how can you teach a course in university when your students care barely understand the words coming out of your mouth?
No Comments
Cannot speak english.
an easy and excellent teacher...very helpful...exams are fairly easy...overall, a recommended course
He is really nice and friendly. Always help students with problems. But he needs to prepare more for the class because sometimes it's not clear what he is saying.
he's quite easy
His math logic is no doubt, excellent! But he needs to be able to communicate more clearly in lectures.

I have to admit this Prof Choi was very nice. After the 1st midterm he remarked a lot of them again and many ppl got 10 marks added to their MTs. Lectures were okay, altho sometimes unclear. Overall he's a nice nice guy.
Needs to learn english.

He's a great prof for an intro calc course! He shows great concern for all of his students and he is ALWAYS willing to help out. His exams are fair and easy to get good marks on; though they can be quite long. You can't go wrong with this guy!
He is extrememly patient and eager to help-and on top of that, as long as you know what you are doing, you are garanteed a great mark! This course with Dr.Choi is a recommended course.

Ppl give Choi a bad review b/c they got a bad mark for the 2nd Midterm. In 1st midterm, more than 1/3 of ppl got 90+%!! Final exam was fair and quite easy. Overall, he is a good prof, and you can easily great marks.

a very nice guy but not a good prof. His exams are too easy ,the average is too high &one mistake makes a huge difference. should make exams more challenging so that the  distribution will be equal, not skewed to the right. not ideal for smart students.

good prof, explain things clear, although sometimes made mistakes, which most math prof do,too.the exams are understandable and related to the note he gave us.  If you attend every lecture, you will be fine.

"I know nothing about economic", said Choi... Very east short 1st midterm, result very high class average. Choi purposely lengthen the 2nd midterm, and say "I only expect SMART student to finish the midterm",... meaning 99%of the stude
Good teacher, made some mistakes but that happens.  However he does have a slight language barrier which isn't his fault.
Easy 1st mid-term. Easy but insanely long 2nd mid-term
Not very gramatically correct.
easy but long exams

thick accent, alternates from going really slow for the first half hour and then crams as much as possible in the last 20 minutes, doesn't explain things very well, makes mistakes here and there (not too many though) in his notes, not particularly nice...
Very quick. Good class if you can keep up with what he's talking about.
good prof~!  his first midterm was easy~!! but second midterm was insanely hard :)  but if you study for the course you can do well.
He has an accent, but he can still get the ideas through. He makes his exams harder as you go along. Be prepared for the final.
Pretty helpful teacher, knows what he's doing in a math sense..doesn't know too much about business math either..sometimes really confusing lectures

Never, in my 18 years of life, have I experienced such TORTURE. Tamon is an AWFUL professor. He doesn't know how to explain concepts, constantly confused, always stuttering (or saying uhhhh), and complicates everything unnecessarily. Unless you're VERY strong in math, willing to self study and go to open lab often, DON'T TAKE THIS CLASS.

He speaks in a slow and confusing manner with pauses and grunts or other sounds every 3-5 seconds. He frequently made mistakes when doing questions in class and often spent time trying to work out his own mistakes.
Tamon is not the best at teaching but it evens out with his easy tests, as long as u self learn a bit you'll be more than fine. I found his tests super easy.

Extremely unclear, you learn more on your own than in class. Doesnt know how to explain or break down concepts. Over analyzes and complicates unnecessarily. Stutters so much. Unless you go to open lab with thr TAs you will fail. Choose any other prof or dont take the course that semester. He is a nice guy but bad prof

He said "ummm" at least 200 times per lecture, was so unclear with everything he said and could never give straightforward answers to a simple question. you learn more on your own than going to lectures, waste of time.

Honestly Tamons lectures are pretty bad, you pretty much have to self learn everything. After the first midterm i just stopped showing up since i learned everything at home. HOWEVER THERE IS A POSITIVE SIDE OF TAMONS CLASS. His tests are pretty easy which balances out his teaching. I managed to get a B+ and i never took calculus in highschool.

Tamon's a genuinely nice guy, but as a prof yikes. His lectures are all over the placehe gets answers wrong even with the key right in front of him. The exams are okay, but sitting through class feels like a test of patience, thanks to the constant uhhhhhhhhh. If you value your time (and sanity), you're better off taking someone else.

He is not good at teaching. I stopped going to lectures after the second midterm. His midterms and finals were fare. His midterms I would say were on the easier side. His hand writing is hard to understand but in general a good guy.

I stopped attending lectures because I found it easier to go to the TA's and ask them questions and to go over topics. Overall, midterms were good and stuck to relevant questions - some actually easier than the textbook questions. This prof is actually very caring and will take time to hear any concerns about grades or missed assignments.

Tamon is really a nice guy with good intentions. Having no background in calculus will make this class really hard. You'll have to teach a lot to yourself, just attending lectures wont be good enough to understand. For MATH157 its not really about the prof, 50 mins classes 3 times a week means you'll need to put in a lot of effort outside class. e

Honestly speaking, Tamon isn't a bad person, but he really can't teach. I only succeeded in his class because I had Calc 12 experience, you end up teaching yourself everything on YouTube. If you have experience the tests aren't too bad and he will tell you what to expect in lectures and workshops. DON'T take with Tamon unless you are strong at math
SWITCH YOUR CLASS BUT DON'T BE IN HIS CLASS AT ALL. This guy yaps in his own words all you hear is his uhhhhhhhh. Worst prof ever had.
Hand to god, this professor has the WORST handwriting I have ever seen. He says uhhhhhh between every word and cannot form a cohesive sentence without interrupting himself.
He's an okay prof. It would be a lot better if he could write a little neater as it's quite difficult to make out what he wrote on the board sometimes. Overall, would recommend taking 157 with him.

His classes were very much useless, you're better off just looking for videos on the topics online. His notes are not helpful either, you won't get any info from him that you don't get from the text, apart from the pop quiz which was not really worth anything, just a few extra marks which don't really help your grade at all.
